poem:
"Burden of the Silver Screen"

On the backlot of regret, she lugs  
the unseen weight of a cinematic mistake -  
One she did not cast, script, or helm.
A public failure, she alone did not create.
From her shoulders falls the film reel flotsam,
an actress unburdening her unwarranted shame. 
Simply a vessel, she declares, lost in cinema's fickle game.
